titles.title: The Devil and the Farmers Wife

properties.verseOrder: v1 c1 v2 v3 v4 v5 v6 v7 v8 v9 v10 v11 v12 v13

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: There was an old farmer and he lived on a hill; If he ain't moved away, he's a livin' there still.

verse.name: c1
verse.lines: Sing hi diddle I diddle I fye, Diddle I diddle I day.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: The devil he came to the farmer one day, Says, "One of your family I'm takin' away."

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: "O, please don't take my eldest son, There's work on the farm that's got to be done."

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: "Take my wife with the joy of my heart, And I hope by golly that you never part."

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: The Devil put the old woman into a sack, And down the road went clickety clack.

verse.name: v6
verse.lines: And when they got to the fork of the road, He says, "Old woman, you're a hell of a load."

verse.name: v7
verse.lines: And when they got to the gates of Hell, He said, "Stoke up the fire, boys, we'll roast her well."

verse.name: v8
verse.lines: Then up stepp'd a devil with ball and chain; She upped with her foot and kicked out his brain.

verse.name: v9
verse.lines: Then nine little devils went running up the wall, Crying, "Take her back, Daddy, she'll murder us all."

verse.name: v10
verse.lines: Well, the old man was peekin' through a crack, When he seen the old Devil come a bringing' her back.

verse.name: v11
verse.lines: "Here's your wife both sound and well, If she'd stayed any longer she'd a torn up Hell."

verse.name: v12
verse.lines: "I've been a devil most all of my life, But I never knew what Hell was 'till I met with your wife."

verse.name: v13
verse.lines: This proves that the women are better than the men, They can all go to Hell and come back again.
